festival.introText:
FLY Open Air returns for its tenth edition next May, with Ben Hemsley, Eliza Rose, Job Jobse, Interplanetary Criminal and Sally C among the first names announced with tickets on sale now.

 

Over the years FLY Open Air has earned its reputation through carefully curated line-ups mixing the world’s best electronic acts while championing homegrown talent in iconic settings. The May edition of the festival takes place in the stunning grounds of Hopetoun House, Scotland’s finest stately home in the outskirts of Edinburgh.

 

Legend in the making Ben Hemsley returns to Fly Open Air with his luring melodies and flavours of old school nostalgia with New Zealand brothers Chaos in the CBD, known for their dreamy take on dance music, also confirmed.

 

Eliza Rose and Interplanetary Criminal, the artists behind this Summer’s most empowering anthem ‘B.O.T.A. (The Baddest Of Them All) join the line-up alongside the universally loved Job Jobse, who made his name as one of Trouw in Amsterdam’s most exciting residents.

 

Inspired selector Sally C, genre-bending Surusinghe and dynamic electronic duo Prospa are also set to play alongside rising stars of the Scottish scene Hannah Laing, Hayley Zalassi and t e s t p r e s s.

 

Tom Ketley, FLY Open Air Director, said: “We’re excited to return for our 10th edition of the festival at Scotland’s finest stately home - Hopetoun House. The site can hold over 8,000 people so we expect this year to be our biggest yet!"

reviews.title: Review of FLY OPEN AIR FESTIVAL

faqs.question: When is FLY Open Air 2023?
faqs.answer: Fly Open Air 2023 will take place Saturday 20th - Sunday 21st May 2023.

faqs.question: Does FLY Open Air have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: No, Fly Open Air is a non camping festival so camping equipment is not needed. However there is plenty of alternative accommodation to choose from.

faqs.question: How much are FLY Open Air tickets?
faqs.answer: Weekend tickets start from £99.25 plus booking fee.

faqs.question: How do I get to FLY Open Air?
faqs.answer:
By Car - Public transport is recommended as there is limited car parking on site. There is also a car and taxi drop off point.

By Taxi - There are several local taxi companies that can run you to and from the estate.

By Bus - Shuttle buses services will be available with First Bus. The Shuttle buses will be running from 11:00am 3:00pm to Hopetoun. Shuttle buses will be leaving Hopetoun from 9:00pm. 

By Rail - The closest train station is Edinburgh Waverley Train Station. The shuttle buses are a short walk from the train station to take you to the festival site.

faqs.question: Where is FLY Open Air?
faqs.answer: Fly Open Air is located at Hopetoun House near Edinburgh, Scotland.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer:
Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.

 

Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Does FLY Open Air have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: Yes you must be 18 or over to attend Fly Open Air. You may be asked to show photo ID.

faqs.question: Can I bring my own food and drink into FLY Open Air?
faqs.answer: You are not allowed to bring your own food and drink into Fly Open Air. There will be a wide variety of food and drink stalls inside the festival.

faqs.question: Are any items prohibited from FLY Open Air?
faqs.answer:
The following items are prohibited from FLY Open Air:

  • No Alcohol or Food - there will be bars & food traders on site
  • No glass of any kind
  • Fireworks, flares or high-power torches
  • No illegal or controlled substances (including psychoactive substances) allowed on site
  • Nitrous oxide
  • Dogs or pets are permitted on site with the exception of assistance dogs
  • Drones / sky lanterns
  • Portable laser equipment and pens
  • Selfie sticks
  • Spray cans / marker pens
  • Professional film / videoing equipment
  • Megaphones / airhorns
  • High-Vis tabards or jackets
  • Bladed or sharp objects
  • Any items which may reasonably be considered for use as a weapon
  • No large bags, only small bags permitted

Review of FLY OPEN AIR FESTIVAL
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Except the horrific shuttle bus service on Saturday (we spent more than 3 hours in total in queues) the venue, the staff and the music was amazing. Boiler room was even better than expected.

reviewsDisplayFour.body: The most amazing party I have ever been!!

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of FLY OPEN AIR FESTIVAL
Review of FLY OPEN AIR FESTIVAL
reviewsDisplayFour.body:
I flew in from London solely for FLY Open Air festival this hear, and I think it's safe to say that I've had the most amazing time! Quite possibly my best ever festival so far if I'm honest.
I'm shocked at how polite and friendly the staff were, even when you could see they were really stressed out. 
Sunday's line up has blown me away. Thank you Fly!
